attributes.action: Utilise Proportional Representation in reforming the House of Lords into an elected second chamber
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For most of the 20th Century the House of Lords has undergone reforms. In 1999 Labour finally removed the hereditary principle for the majority of peers. In 2009, in Brighton, the Prime Minister pledged to continue House of Lord reform.

This is a start but there is still much to do. By signing this petition we acknowledge that the House of Lords does play an important role in the government and therefore want it to represent the people of this country.

This can be achieved through providing an elected second chamber using proportional representation to account fully for the great variety of political opinion within the UK.

Due to PR usually producing no clear majority, this House will not be dominated by party politics and therefore can review legislature from the Commons with less bias and necessitate parties working together. This will mean that the government will be more accountable to a representative body of the people.
